title: Don't inject search syntax into the NewDot search field unless the user explicitly enters it

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background
Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1762990057809999), we'd like to make the search bar cleaner when the user is clicking around and filtering within the **Reports** page of NewDot.

## Details
When you click around the different sections of the **Reports** page in NewDot, you notice that different search syntaxes populate in the search field, like so:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8aafb3c-65ca-467e-ab95-7659c7e0d54f

The syntaxes also populate when you set filters manually, like so:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a25b0f72-9369-410d-9a76-885d964b89dd

## Expected result
We don't want the search field to populate with syntaxes in these cases. It should instead stay completely empty for a cleaner experience. The only case where we want search syntax in the search field is when the user enters it manually. Thanks!


cc @JmillsExpensify @trjExpensify 

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @sobitneupane</details>

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1762991489288979?thread_ts=1762106013.099829&cid=C07NMDKEFMH), we'd like to adjust two things: button copy **and** what happens when you click said button. ## Details In New Expensify, **only** for the case where the **Reports** > **Submit** page is empty and you see a modal like this: We want to change **two things**: 1. Change the button copy from `Create report` to `Create expense` 2. Change what happens when you click that button, so it instead opens up the `Create expense` pane ## Expected outcome

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.55-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1951/folder/15397164/57243981/1010742221?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsnoidjdosisjdios@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - running `SSetNameValuePair('useCustomReportNamesNewExpensify', 'true');` in the JavaScript console on OldDot - Rename Default report title to {report:submit:from:firstName} in workspace settings > Reports. - User has display name. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an empty report via + > Create report. 4. Go to Account > Profile > Display name. 5. Change the first name and save it. 6. Go back to the workspace chat. → Report name is not updated after changing display name. 7. Add an expense to the empty report. → Report title is only updated after adding an expense to the report. ## Expected Result: In Step 6, Report name will be updated after changing display name. ## Actual Result: In Step 6, Report name is not updated after changing display name. In Step 7, Report title is only updated after adding an expense to the report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/78c118ca-3457-41ad-b8e6-c50049453074 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.55-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1950/folder/15397164/57245516/1010741310 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Dreamnitethedragonwo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Open workpace chat 3. Enable forced offline 4. Create an expense 5. Submit and approve 6. Go to reports 7. Change default report title as {report:type} {report:status} 8. Go to workspace chat 9. Create an an expense 10. Submit and approve the expense 11. Note the title header of expense created in step 4 and step 9 12. Turn off forced offline 13. Note the title header of expense created in step 4 and step 9 14. Create a new workspace 15. Add a manual expense 16. Submit and approve the expense 17. Go to reports 18. Change default report title as {report:type} {report:status} 19.Go to workspace chat 20. Create an an expense 21. Submit and approve the expense 22. Note the title header of expense created in step 4 and step 9 ## Expected Result: Report name must not change to the report ID, the status must update correctly. ## Actual Result: Report name changes to the report ID, the status does not updated correctly. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/faf65d18-41d0-4603-a646-728ebbdfd231 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.55-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1951/folder/13176741/41237124/1010741644?sort=%2Bidentifier, https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73463 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsnoidjdosisjdios@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - "Submission frequency" is set to Instantly. - "Add approvals" and "Make or track payments" are disabled. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click More > Retract. 6. Click report header > Title. 7. Rename it (for identification later). 8. Go back to workspace chat. 9. Click + > Create expense > Manual. 10. Enter amount > Next. → On confirm page, Report field shows the existing report from Step 6. 11. Click Create expense. ## Expected Result: The new expense will be added to the existing report from Step 6 as indicated on confirm page (Step 10), according to https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72930. ## Actual Result: The new expense is created in a new report when the confirm page indicates that it will be added to the existing report (Step 10). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29095462-729a-47ca-b479-53536f566045 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.55-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1950/folder/15397164/57245516/1010741310 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** [wo@gmail.com](mailto:wo@gmail.com) **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Go to workspace settings 3. Set default report title as {report:type} {report:status} 4. Open workpace chat 5. Toggle on forced offline 6. Create a empty report 7. Open the report 8. Tap add expense and create an expense 9. Open the expense 10. Tap submit and note title header 11. Tap approve and note title header ## Expected Result: For expense created in offline, report status in the report title (`Report status {report:status}`) must be updated to "processing" after approving expense ## Actual Result: For expense created in offline, report status in the report title (`Report status {report:status}`) remains "open" after approving expense ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
